directions: In a bowl toss lamb with seasoned flour until well coated. In a 4- to 6-quart heavy saucepan heat 1 tablespoon oil over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking and brown lamb in 2 batches, transferring to another bowl. In pan cook onion and garlic in remaining tablespoon oil over moderate heat, stirring, until softened. Add carrots, celery, brown sugar, thyme, spices, and salt and pepper to taste and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add wine, broth, and lamb. Simmer stew over low heat, partially covered, stirring occasionally, 2 1/2 hours, until thickened and lamb is very tender.
Serve stew over couscous or noodles.
ingredients: 2 pounds boneless lamb shoulder, trimmed and cut into 1-inch cubes
3 tablespoons all-purpose flour seasoned with salt and pepper
4 celery ribs, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces
title: Lamb Stew Ciuba
